member.name: P:C1.Olap.C1OlapField.WeightField
member.summary: Gets or sets the used as a weight for calculating subtotals on this field.

remarks.para: If this property is set to null, all values are assumed to have weight one.

This property allows you to calculate weighted averages and totals. For example, if the data contains a 'Quantity' field and a 'Price' field, you could use the 'Price' field as a value field and the 'Quantity' field as a weight. The output would contain a weighted average of the data.

Customizing the appearance of a field can be useful in views that contain multiple value fields.
For example, the code below creates a view with two value fields and gives one of the fields a green background:
You can also create conditional styles using the and properties.

member.name: T:C1.Olap.C1OlapKey
member.summary: Represents a combination of objects and their values.

remarks.para: Each row and column on the output Olap table is defined by a unique . The values in the table cells represent an aggregation of the value field for all items that match the row and column keys.

For example, if a column key is set to 'Country:UK;Customer:Joe' and the row key is set to 'Category:Desserts;Product:Pie', then the corresponding cell contains the aggregate for all items with the following properties: 'Country:UK;Customer:Joe;Category:Desserts;Product:Pie'.

member.summary: Gets a value that determines whether a given data object matches the content of this .
member.param: Item that contains the raw data.
member.returns: True if the matches this .

remarks.para: The match is determined by comparing the formatted values for each in the key to the formatted values in the . Therefore, matches may occur even if the raw values are different.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Olap.C1OlapPage

remarks.para: The control contains an on the left and a tabbed content area on the right.
The allows users to select and customize the fields that should be included in the Olap analysis.
The tabbed content area contains three pages: a and a that show the Olap analysis, and a plain grid that shows the raw data.
The control also provides a customizable menu with commonly used commands.

member.summary: Provides a complete user interface for Olap applications.

member.name: T:C1.Silverlight.Olap.C1OlapPanel

remarks.para: Olap pivot tables group data into one or more dimensions. The dimensions are represented by rows and columns on a grid, and the data is stored in the grid cells.
Use the property to set the source table, then use the property to get the output table.
If you use a to show the output data, then set the grid's property to the appropriate C1OlapPanel.

member.summary: Provides a user interface for interactively transforming regular data tables into Olap pivot tables.
